Container.Name: gluetun
Container.Overview:
Gluetun VPN Client
Is a lightweight swiss-knife-like VPN client to tunnel many different VPN Providers to VPN servers using Go, OpenVPN or Wireguard, iptables, DNS over TLS, ShadowSocks and an HTTP proxy
Usage: Add "--network=container:gluetun-vpn-client" to a docker container's "Extra Parameters" (If you change the container name be sure to change "--network=container:GLUETUN-CONTAINER-NAME") And set "Network Type" to "None" Then add that container WebUI port to gluetun More info here: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Port-mapping (don't use localhost if you are on a lan device. for example a laptop or desktop, just use the server ip)
More info on Custom OpenVPN Configuration here: (By default the openvpn file need to be named custom.conf) https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/OpenVPN-configuration-file
For Wireguard I recommend reading this first: https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Wireguard
Features: - Based on Alpine 3.15 for a small Docker image of 29MB - Supports: Cyberghost, ExpressVPN, FastestVPN, HideMyAss, IPVanish, IVPN, Mullvad, NordVPN, Perfect Privacy, Privado, Private Internet Access, PrivateVPN, ProtonVPN, PureVPN, Surfshark, TorGuard, VPNUnlimited, Vyprvpn, WeVPN, Windscribe servers - Supports OpenVPN for all providers listed - Supports Wireguard both kernelspace and userspace - For Mullvad, Ivpn and Windscribe - For Torguard, VPN Unlimited and WeVPN using the custom provider - For custom Wireguard configurations using the custom provider - More in progress, see #134 - DNS over TLS baked in with service provider(s) of your choice - DNS fine blocking of malicious/ads/surveillance hostnames and IP addresses, with live update every 24 hours - Choose the vpn network protocol, udp or tcp - Built in firewall kill switch to allow traffic only with needed the VPN servers and LAN devices - Built in Shadowsocks proxy (protocol based on SOCKS5 with an encryption layer, tunnels TCP+UDP) - Built in HTTP proxy (tunnels HTTP and HTTPS through TCP) - Connect other containers to it - Connect LAN devices to it Display - Compatible with amd64, i686 (32 bit), ARM 64 bit, ARM 32 bit v6 and v7, and even ppc64le 🎆 - Custom VPN server side port forwarding for Private Internet Access - Possibility of split horizon DNS by selecting multiple DNS over TLS providers - Unbound subprogram drops root privileges once launched - Can work as a Kubernetes sidecar container, thanks @rorph

Config.Name: VPN_TYPE
Config.Description: Default is OpenVPN, supports Wireguard. Note not all providers support Wireguard.

Config.Name: VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER
Config.Description: Choose a VPN Service Provider

Config.Name: OPENVPN_USER
Config.Description: OpenVPN Username

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OpenVPN Password

Config.Name: SERVER_REGIONS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN regions. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_COUNTRIES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN countries. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_CITIES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN cities. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_NAMES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Single server hostname. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAMES
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: REGION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN regions. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: COUNTRY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN countries. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: CITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN cities. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY
Config.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes private key in base64 format

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY
Config.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes pre-shared key in base64 format

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY
Config.Description: Only for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom and VPN_TYPE=wireguard: Wireguard server public key

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESS
Config.Description: Wireguard IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP
Config.Description: Only for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom and VPN_TYPE=wireguard: Wireguard server endpoint IP address

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_PORT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL (required for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom): Wireguard custom server endpoint port to use

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_INTERFACE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESSES
Config.Description: Wireguard IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User id - Default 99

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group id - Default 100

Config.Name: TIMEZONE
Config.Description: Specify a timezone for logs times

Config.Name: APPDATA
Config.Description: Where to store persistent data

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: The variable to set Custom OpenVPN configuration file. This implies VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG_PATH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: The path to your Custom OpenVPN configuration file. This implies VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PROTOCOL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Network protocol to use, only valid for OpenVPN - Default udp

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERSION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Set the OpenVPN version to run - Default 2.5

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERBOSITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: OpenVPN verbosity level - Default 1

Config.Name: OPENVPN_FLAGS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Space delimited OpenVPN flags to pass to openvpn

Config.Name: OPENVPN_ROOT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Run OpenVPN as root

Config.Name: VPN_ENDPOINT_IP
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a target VPN IP address to use

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CIPHERS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify one or more custom ciphers to use. i.e. aes-256-gcm

Config.Name: OPENVPN_AUTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom auth algorithm to use. i.e. sha256

Config.Name: OPENVPN_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable tunneling of IPv6 (only for Mullvad)

Config.Name: OPENVPN_MSSFIX
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Set the MSS fix parameter. 0 to 9999 - Default 0

Config.Name: OPENVPN_INTERFACE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use - Default tun0

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal Shadowsocks proxy

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable Shadowsocks logging

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to Shadowsocks

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: AEAD Cipher to use for Shadowsocks

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Logs every tunnel requests

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PORT
Config.Description: Internal port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on. Port 1024 to 65535

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_USER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Username to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_STEALTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Stealth mode means HTTP proxy headers are not added to your requests

Config.Name: FIREWALL
Config.Description: Turn on or off the container built-in firewall. You should only turn off for debugging purposes.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow from the VPN server side (useful for vyprvpn port forwarding)

Config.Name: FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow through the default interface. This seems needed for Unraid containers and Kubernetes sidecars.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_DEBUG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Prints every firewall related command. You should use it for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated subnets that Gluetun and the containers sharing its network stack are allowed to access. This involves firewall and routing modifications. For example with FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS=192.168.1.0/24

Config.Name: DOT
Config.Description: Activate DNS over TLS with Unbound (Recommended: on)

Config.Name: DOT_PROVIDERS
Config.Description: Select one of the following DNS over TLS providers

Config.Name: DOT_CACHING
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound caching

Config.Name: DOT_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: DNS IPv6 resolution

Config.Name: DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS
Config.Description: All private CIDRs ranges. Comma separated list of CIDRs or single IP addresses Unbound won't resolve to. Note that the default setting prevents DNS rebinding

Config.Name: DOT_VERBOSITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound verbosity level

Config.Name: DOT_VERBOSITY_DETAILS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound details verbosity level

Config.Name: DOT_VALIDATION_LOGLEVEL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound validation log level

Config.Name: DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update block lists and cryptographic files and restart Unbound. Set to 0 to deactivate updates.

Config.Name: BLOCK_MALICIOUS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block malicious hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block surveillance hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_ADS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block ads hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: UNBLOCK
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of domain names to leave unblocked with Unbound. i.e. domain1.com,x.domain2.co.uk

Config.Name: DNS_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: IP address to use as DNS resolver if DOT is off

Config.Name: DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Keep the nameservers in /etc/resolv.conf untouched, but disabled DNS blocking features

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_ADDRESS
Config.Description: Listening address for the HTTP control server

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable logging of HTTP requests

Config.Name: HEALTH_TARGET_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Address to ping on every internal health check

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Initial duration to wait for the VPN to be ready before restarting it.

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Additional duration to add to the wait time for each consecutive failure of the VPN.

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to check for public IP address. Set to 0 to disable.

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_FILE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned. !!This will be removed in the v4 program, instead you might want to use the HTTP control server

Config.Name: VERSION_INFORMATION
Config.Description: Logs a message indicating if a newer version is available once the VPN is connected

Config.Name: UPDATER_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update all VPN servers information in memory and to /gluetun/servers.json. Set to 0 to disable. This does a burst of DNS over TLS requests, which may be blocked if you set BLOCK_MALICIOUS=on for example. Valid duration string such as 24h.

Config.Name: UPDATER_VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDERS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: List of providers to update servers data for, when the updater triggers periodically. If left empty, it defaults to the current VPN provider used at start.
